revised_title: Exploring the cGMP-Activated Channel Properties of Retinal On-Bipolar Cells
tldr: The authors studied the properties of the cGMP-activated channel in retinal on-bipolar cells and compared them with rod photoreceptors. They found that the on-bipolar cell channel was blocked by L-m-diltiazem, a block that was strongly voltage-dependent. However, the on-bipolar cell channel was not identical to the photoreceptor channel. The study also showed that the conductance of the on-bipolar cell channels was unaffected by the removal of external divalent cations.
